This is a Transactional Operation, hence it is journalized. Journalized operations can either be rolled back or committed automatically, restoring or removing the backup file(s), respectively. In case an of any kind occurs, all journalized operations are rolled back, resulting in the original state to be restored.
remarks.note: If no occurs and the completes successfully, all operations enlisted inside the Transactional Journal are committed. Any modifications made are then preserved and after which the backup file(s) are removed.

remarks.para: This is a Non-Transactional Operation, hence it is not journalized. As there is no need to rollback any modifications made, in case an of any kind occurs inside the .

This is a Transactional Operation, that creates a directory, hence it is journalized. Journalized operations can either be rolled back or committed automatically, removing or keeping the created directory, respectively. In case an of any kind occurs, all journalized operations are rolled back, resulting in the original state to be restored.
remarks.note: If no occurs and the completes successfully, all operations enlisted inside the Transactional Journal are committed. Any modifications made are then preserved.

remarks.para: This is a Transactional Operation, that deletes a directory, hence it is journalized. Journalized operations can either be rolled back or committed automatically, restoring or keeping the directory deleted, respectively. In case an of any kind occurs, all journalized operations are rolled back, resulting in the original state be restored.
remarks.note: If no occurs and the completes successfully, all operations enlisted inside the Transactional Journal are committed. Any modifications made are then preserved.

remarks.para: This is an operation that returns information about the directory or its contents, hence it is not journalized. There is no need for the operation to be rolled back.

This is a Transactional Operation, that modifies a directory and/or its contents, hence it is journalized. Journalized operations can either be rolled back or committed automatically, restoring or removing the backup directory and its contents, respectively. In case an of any kind occurs, all journalized operations are rolled back, resulting in the original state to be restored.
remarks.note: If no occurs and the completes successfully, all operations enlisted inside the Transactional Journal are committed. Any modifications made are then preserved and the backup directory and its contents (if any) is then removed.

remarks.para: This is a Non-Transactional Operation, that returns information about the file system, hence it is not journalized. There is no need for the operation to be rolled back.
